    Life Chain In Toronto

    December 9 2014

    So a few weekends ago we went and played Not Dead Yet 2014 in Toronto. It’s the third (?) iteration of the festival and we played last year as well. It takes place all over the Downtown area in about 10 venues across 4 days. It was an insane weekend and, as most big festivals are, a chance to see lots of tour friends from around the world. I saw some people from the West coast that I hadn’t seen in 2 or 3 years and that was wonderful. We made and unloaded a bunch of merch, which these dudes sold for us:

    Playing was a lot of fun, but even better was the chance to catch some incredible sets. Institute from Texas have been my favorite band of the year, with the Salt EP being my favorite record of the year by far. They did not fail to hold up to expectations live either, it was so so so good. The other really killer set of the weekend was DiE from the UK:

    They also held up to their recordings, though I caught them in New York in April so already knew what to expect. My friend Ben broke his rib during their set, though that was pretty much his own fault.

    We stayed in an AirBnB in Kensington market which was huge, nice, cheap, and close to everything. I’ve stayed in AirBnBs in New York, Seattle, and Toronto and they’ve all been awesome. Down with hotels, up with AirBnBs. I was disappointed to not score many records while in Toronto except for a few 7”s, but all in all it was a great weekend and a nice getaway.
